1.title: Bird Box
1.plot: Mike and Jay review the Netflix film Bird Box while they also talk about the Bird Box challenge.

2.title: Glass
2.plot: M. Night Shyamalan made another movie. This one is called Glass.

1.title: Drive Angry and The Adjustment Bureau
1.plot: Mike and Jay go to fix Mr. Plinkett's VCR, but find themselves talking about 2 new movies instead.

2.title: Battle: Los Angeles and The Galaxy Invader
2.plot: Jay and Mike discuss a new sci-fi alien invasion film, and a "classic" one from the 1980's.

3.title: Paul and Toronto Comic Con
3.plot: Jay and Mike review the film Paul, and talk about their trip to comic-con.

4.title: Sucker Punch
4.plot: Jay and Mike share their thoughts on the Zack Snyder film, Sucker Punch.

5.title: Your Highness and Samurai Cop
5.plot: Jay and Mike take on David Gordon Green's "Your Highness" as well as the should-be cult classic "Samurai Cop".

6.title: Scream 4 and No Brand Con
6.plot: What was more frightening: a masked killer or tons of anime fans in costumes while intoxicated? Find out for yourself in episode 6 of Half in the Bag.

7.title: Super and The Watchman
7.plot: Half in the Bag Episode 7? What's so super about Super? And real life super hero (R.L.S.H) The Watchman stops by to chat with Jay and Mike.

8.title: Troll 2 and Best Worst Movie
8.plot: Jay and Mike are joined by the suspicious Officer Cooper for a double feature of Troll 2 and the documentary 'Best Worst Movie'.

9.title: Summer Movie Round-Up
9.plot: Just a lazy day at work talkin' bout' movies and unfixing a VCR..

10.title: The 48-Hour Film Project
10.plot: Mike and Jay explain the process of participating in the 48 Hour Film Project and shooting a short film in such a small amount of time.

11.title: Transformers 3
11.plot: Just another day at the office.

12.title: Captain America and The Rocketeer
12.plot: Mike and Jay of Red Letter Media discuss Marvel's latest feature-length trailer for the Avengers movie.

13.title: Cowboys and Aliens
13.plot: Jay and Mike discuss the film Cowboys and Aliens while mysterious assailants throw bricks through Mr. Plinkett's window.

14.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes and Cyphan Con 2011
14.plot: Mike and Jay discuss a recent monkey movie, then recount their experiences at a recent Chicago-area sci-fi convention.

15.title: Chicago Comic Con 2011 Recap
15.plot: The most cynical, sarcastic coverage of comic con yet.

16.title: Fright Night and Conan the Barbarian
16.plot: Mike and Jay discuss two pointless remakes, as well as discover a mystery.

17.title: The People vs. George Lucas and Star Wars Discussion
17.plot: Mike and Jay are joined by Alexandre Philippe, director of the documentary The People vs. George Lucas, to discuss all things Star Wars, including the new blu-ray alterations and what's wrong with George Lucas' brain.

18.title: Drive and Contagion
18.plot: Mike and Jay discuss two unconventional new releases, then have to figure out with a pesky new VCR.

19.title: Robot and The Last Circus
19.plot: Mike and Jay go to the Milwaukee Film Festival to see two weirdo foreign films. Mike learns all about a causality loop and how to alter history.

20.title: What's Your Number and The Black Ninja: Part 1
20.plot: Jay and Mike are joined by a female stand-up comedian who shares a much different view than them on romantic comedies and horrible b-movie schlock.

21.title: What's Your Number and The Black Ninja: Part 2
21.plot: Jay and Mike continue their discussion with the stand-up comedian, this time dissecting the technical ineptitude of B-movie "The Black Ninja."

22.title: Jack and Jill: Part 1
22.plot: Mike and Jay criticise, analyse and dissect the 2011 "Comedy" film from Adam Sandler

23.title: Jack and Jill: Part 2
23.plot: Mike and Jay continue their discussion of Adam Sandler's evil scheme.

1.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo and 2011 Recap
1.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the latest film from David Fincher, as well as some other 2011 releases that they were too lazy to review earlier in the year.

2.title: The Devil Inside and Flyin' Ryan
2.plot: Jay and Mike discuss having a Devil Inside and how some kid can fly with magical bike reflectors attached to his shoes or whatever.

3.title: Red Tails
3.plot: Jay and Mike see Red Tails then have a poignant discussion about race and George Lucas.

4.title: B-Fest 2012 Recap
4.plot: Jay and Mike talk about all the amazing films they saw at this year's B-fest, a festival dedicated to terrible movies.

5.title: Chronicle and Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
5.plot: Mike and Jay discuss a teen super power film as well as the latest Nicholas Cage flop. Meanwhile, Mr. Plinkett starts his search for love.

6.title: Silent House and John Carter
6.plot: Mr. Plinkett's got a hot date. Meanwhile Mike and Jay discuss recent releases Silent House and the sci-fi flop John Carter.

7.title: The Hunger Games and Jeff Who Lives at Home
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: Cabin in the Woods and The Three Stooges
8.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the pros and cons of Cabin in the Woods and The Three Stooges, while also proving to Plinkett their worthlessness may never end.

9.title: Zaat!
9.plot: Being too lazy to bother seeing any new releases, Mike and Jay discuss the semi-cult classic film Zaat, about a scientist that turns himself into a giant catfish monster.

10.title: The Avengers and CPHPIX Film Festival
10.plot: Mike and Jay see The Avengers.

11.title: Battleship and Dark Shadows
11.plot: Continuing their journey to the VCR repair shop, Mike and Jay take a break to discuss the latest Hollywood flops Battleship starring Johnny Depp and Dark Shadows starring Rihanna.

12.title: Prometheus
12.plot: Mike and Jay talk about the divisive new film Prometheus, Ridley Scott's kinda-sorta prequel to G.I. Jane.

13.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter and That's My Boy
13.plot: Mike and Jay hitch a ride from the worst green screen ever and discuss two more recent Hollywood flops: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter and the brilliant Adam Sandler's latest masterpiece, That's My Boy.

14.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
14.plot: The string of quality summer blockbusters continues with The Amazing Spider-Man. Mike, Jay, along with their new friend Rich, discuss while wanting to kill themselves.

15.title: The Dark Knight Rises
15.plot: Mike and Jay see some little independent film nobody's heard of called The Dark Knight Rises, directed by Christopher Nolan.

16.title: Step-Up Revolution
16.plot: Mike and Jay have finally arrived at the VCR Repair Shop. They use the opportunity to discuss the latest Step Up film in great detail for an extended period of time, with absolutely no distractions or surprise cameos.

17.title: Resident Evil Series: Part 1
17.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Paul WS Anderson's Resident Evil series.

18.title: Resident Evil Series: Part 2
18.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Paul WS Anderson's Resident Evil series.

19.title: Looper and Dredd
19.plot: Jay and Mike talk about Looper and Dredd. Meanwhile a charitable act leads to good fortune for Lightning Fast VCR repair.

20.title: Sinister and Paranormal Activity 4
20.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the recent horror flops Sinister and Paranormal Activity 4. Meanwhile, some creepy things begin to happen around Old Man Plinkett's house. Could it be a Baghuul problem?

21.title: Skyfall
21.plot: After a bizarre encounter with Mr. Plinkett, Mike and Jay decide to see the latest James Bond film, Skyfall, starring that guy from Cowboys and Aliens.

22.title: Twilight: Breaking Dawn Part 2
22.plot: Mike and Jay saw the new Twilight movie.

23.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
23.plot: Mike and Jay talk about Peter Jackson's latest trip to Middle-Earth, The Hobbit, and frustrate both Tolkien fans and HFR projection supporters in the process.

24.title: Django Unchained and 2012 Recap
24.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Quentin Tarantino's new film Django Unchained, starring Jamie Foxx and Christoph Waltz, and recount some films they've seen in 2012 that they forgot about until just now.

1.title: The Last Stand and a Haunted House
1.plot: Mike and Jay discuss The Last Stand, Arnold Schwarzenberg's mediocre return to starring in mediocre action movies. They also spend more time contemplating the Marlon Wayans spoof comedy A Haunted House than Marlon Wayans did when he wrote the script.

2.title: Warm Bodies and Movie 43
2.plot: Mike and Jay discuss some movie that they've already forgotten the title of, as well as the critically darling, Movie 43.

3.title: A Good Day to Die Hard
3.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Bruce Willis' latest paycheck. Meanwhile, Mr. Plinkett puts his foot down about the progress of his VCR repair.

4.title: Hansel and Gretel: Witch Hunters and Jack the Giant Slayer
4.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the latest action fantasy films adapted from old timey fairy tales, and discuss this baffling recent trend.

5.title: Oz the Great and Powerful and Return to Oz
5.plot: Mike and Jay discuss all things Oz. As well as deal with Mr. Plinkett's recent drug addition problem.

6.title: Evil Dead
6.plot: Mike and Jay literally got to Hell to discuss yet another remake. This time it's Evil Dead, a modern update on the Sam Raimi cult classic.

7.title: Oblivion and the Lords of Salem
7.plot: After burying the body of Mailman Tommy, Mike and Jay discuss the sci fi action film Oblivion, directed by the guy responsible for everyone's favorite movie, Tron: Legacy. They then discuss the horror film The Lords of Salem, directed by the guy responsible for everyone's OTHER favorite movie, the Halloween remake.

8.title: Iron Man 3 and Pain and Gain
8.plot: While business begins to boom at the VCR repair shop, Mike and Jay use their lunch break to talk about the latest Marvel film Pain and Gain, as well as Michael Bay's newest product, Iron Man 3.

9.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: The Hangover Part III and After Earth
10.plot: In the epic conclusion to Half in the Bag's "Hipster Trilogy," Mike and Jay discuss the "final" Hangover film (unless it makes a ton of money and a Hangover part IV is rushed into production) as well as After Earth, the latest collaboration of two of cinema's finest: M. Night Shyamalan and Will Smith.

11.title: Man of Steel
11.plot: Mike, Jay, and their new friend Rich Evans (a different Rich Evans or something) discuss the latest iteration of Superman, this one being too cool and "real" to actually be called Superman. Also, Mr. Plinkett receives some distressing news that may lead to him losing his house. Is this the end of Half in the Bag??!. (spoiler: it isn't)

12.title: The Lone Ranger and White House Down
12.plot: Mike and Jay discuss two recent flops that both have the exact same poster.

13.title: Grown Ups 2
13.plot: Mike and Jay talk about Adam Sandler's recent abomination, and kidding themselves over the movie's positive points causes them to severely hemorrhage.

14.title: Pacific Rim
14.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Guillermo Del Toro's sci fi fantasy monsters vs. robots film Pacific Rim.

15.title: The Wolverine
15.plot: Jay and Mike take on The Wolverine and also discuss the film that came before that, Xmen origins: Will. i. Amverine.

16.title: Summer Movie Catch Up and Things
16.plot: Jay and Mike find Plinkett and meet his new roommate, Palpy. While there they discuss movies they missed as well as talk about a movie called "Things".

17.title: Gravity and Carrie
17.plot: Mike and Jay give Mr. Plinkett some chores to do while they discuss the lost in space adventure film Gravity starring George Clooney and Sandra Bullock as well as the horror flop Carrie.

18.title: Ender's Game and Thor: The Dark World
18.plot: Mike and Jay discuss a recent sci-fi flop and a sci-fi hit. First up is Ender's Game, based on the novel by Orson Scott Card and then the Marvel sequel Thor: The Dark World, in which Mike and Jay constantly refer to magical elves as aliens because who cares?

19.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
19.plot: Happy Holidays, everyone. In this special Christmas episode Mike and Jay put Mr. Plinkett to work so they can be lazy and discuss Peter Jackson's latest six hour movie about little people walking around a lot, The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug.

1.title: The Wolf of Wall Street and 2013 Re-cap
1.plot: As with previous years, Mike and Jay close out 2013 by seeing an actual good movie by a well-regarded director. This year it's Martin Scorsese's crime epic The Wolf of Wall Street. Meanwhile, Mr. Plinkett eats a 37 double bacon cheeseburgers because hijinks.

2.title: The Legend of Hercules and Her
2.plot: It's January. Mike and Jay celebrate cinema's greatest month by seeing The Legend of Hercules and then try to make up for that by seeing Spike Jonze's latest film Her.

3.title: RoboCop
3.plot: Mike and Jay are joined by a real life Milwaukee police officer to talk about all things Robocop. Bonds are formed, emotional wounds are mended, and everyone learns to love themselves, and each other.

4.title: RoboCop 2014
4.plot: Joined by their new police officer friend, Mike and Jay check out the remake/reboot/rehash Robocop.

5.title: Cheap Thrills and the Grand Budapest Hotel
5.plot: After a failed Weekend at Bernie's homage, Jay and Mike discuss two non-Hollywood films in an attempt to regain their sanity.

6.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
6.plot: Mike and Jay see the latest Marvel blockbuster, Captain America: The Winter Soldier and are then challenged by Mr. Plinkett to remember the plots of this endless onslaught of superhero movies.

7.title: Transcendence and the Amazing Spider-Man 2
7.plot: Mike, Jay, and their new friend Rich Evans check out the most critically praised movie of the year, Transcendence, as well as the obligatory sequel to The Amazing Spider-Man.

8.title: Godzilla (98) and Godzilla
8.plot: Jay and Mike see the new Godzilla movie whilst Richard Evans is forced against his will to watch the 1998 Godzilla movie.

9.title: X-Men Days of Future Past/A Million Ways to Die in the West
9.plot: Even though Jay and Mike have never been to college or read a book, they are on Spring Break!. SPRING BREAK!!.

10.title: Deliver Us from Evil, Edge of Tomorrow, and Transformers 4
10.plot: While on a job with a new client, Mike and Jay discuss a film no-one cares about, a film nobody saw and a film nobody likes.

11.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
11.plot: After a year, Mike and Jay return to Mr. Plinkett's house. Once they re-introduce themselves to chairs, the two discuss Dawn of the Planet of the Apes.

12.title: Boyhood and Guardians of the Galaxy
12.plot: Mike and Jay check out a recent little indie drama (Guardians of the Galaxy) and a sci fi blockbuster (Boyhood).

13.title: Into the Storm/Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
13.plot: Mike and Jay are joined by a construction worker named "Rich" "Evans" to talk about Into the Storm, a found footage rip off of Twister, and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, a modern day rip off of your childhood heroes.

14.title: 2014 Movie Catch-up: Part 1
14.plot: Mike and Jay discuss some of the movies that they've seen this year that haven't been previously talked about on Half in the Bag.

15.title: 2014 Movie Catch-up: Part 2
15.plot:
Know what this is about?

16.title: Gone Girl and Annabelle
16.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

17.title: Interstellar
17.plot: While Mr. Plinkett's house floats across Lake Michigan, Mike and Jay attempt to wrap their brains around Christopher Nolan's latest film Interstellar. Mike also discusses some previous films about black holes such as Event Horizon and The Black Hole.

18.title: Nightcrawler and Birdman
18.plot: Mike and Jay decide to sit out Dumb and Dumber To and see some good movies instead.

19.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
19.plot: Jay and Mike talk about The third and final Hobbit film - while sitting in a house on the bottom of a lake.

1.title: Inherent Vice and Oscar Buzz
1.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the latest PT Barnum joint Inherent Vice, and then talk about the 2015 Oscar nominations, proving why they've never discussed previous years' Oscar nominations.

2.title: Jupiter Ascending and Battlefield Earth
2.plot: Still at the bottom of Lake Michigan, Mike and Jay pass the time by discussing the latest Wachowski siblings flop Jupiter Ascending, as well as the comparable sci fi flop Battlefield Earth starring John Travolta.

3.title: Chappie
3.plot: Finally free from the depths of Lake Michigan, Mike and Jay talk about Neil Blomcrap's latest film Chappie.

4.title: Furious 7 and It Follows
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Unfriended and Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
5.plot: Mike and Jay check out Unfriended and Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2 because they hate themselves.

6.title: Disney's Marvel's Avengers: Age of Ultron
6.plot: Mike and Jay finally return to the VCR repair shop to discover a horrifying secret. They also watch Avengers: Age of Ultron.

7.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
7.plot: Mike and Jay sneak back into the VCR repair shop to pick up some treasured DVDs as well as talk about their thoughts on the new Mad Max film, Fury Road.

8.title: Jurassic World
8.plot: Mike and Jay settle into their new positions as employees of the video game repair shop, and then discuss the latest reboot/re-imagining/remake/re-sequel Jurassic World.

9.title: Terminator Genisys
9.plot: Mike and Jay talk about the stupid new Terminator movie.

10.title: Ant-Man
10.plot: Mike and Jay talk about Ant-Man while minding the video game repair shop.

11.title: Pixels
11.plot: Mike and Jay (along with Rich and Jack) attempt to comprehend the thought process that would go into creating a lazy, creatively-bankrupt film such as Adam Sandler's "Pixels". But more importantly, the gang analyzes and differentiates the phrases "for some reason" and "for no reason."

12.title: Fantastic Four
12.plot: Mike and Jay attempt to see Mission Impossible: Rogue Nation, but are unable to. Josh Trank himself buys Mike and Jay tickets to see Fantastic Four. They are the only people in the theater. Not just their theater, but every theater in the nation.

13.title: American Ultra
13.plot: Mike and Jay talk extensively about a movie that's already come out and flopped and been forgotten, American Ultra.

14.title: The Visit and Turbo Kid
14.plot: Mike and Jay prepare to make a visit of their own before discussing two new movies, The Visit and Turbo Kid.

15.title: Everest
15.plot: Mike and Jay take a break while climbing Mt. Everest to talk about Everest. They are on their way up to Mr. Plinkett's house on the top. Even though he climbed down in a recent episode to kill them. Now I guess he went back up and wants his VCR fixed. Hey. He lives up there, what do you want him to do stay in a motel. He can't afford that. But he can afford to spend lots of money trying to fix a VCR to watch an old TV show from the 80's.

16.title: 2015 Re-Cap (So Far)
16.plot: Mike and Jay continue to sit on Mt. Everest as they discuss a bunch of movies they've seen so far this year that they haven't discussed already.

17.title: Creed and Victor Frankenstein
17.plot: Mike and Jay finally reach the top of Mt. Everest to fix Mr. Plinkett's VCR or whatever. Unfortunately, Mr. Plinkett is nowhere to be found so the guys are forced to talk about movies. It's Creed and Victor Frankenstein.

18.title: Krampus
18.plot: Merry Krampus, everyone. Mike and Jay talk about the latest Christmas-themed horror film Krampus, as well as all the shitty no budget Krampus knock-offs that have come out this year. Also, Mr. Plinkett's back.

19.title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens
19.plot: It's episode 100 of Half in the Bag. Mike, Jay, and their new friend Kris Kringle celebrate this momentous event by participating in a normal episode and see the newest Star Warts movie. Lightsabers.

1.title: The Hateful Eight/The Ridiculous 6
1.plot: Still stranded on Mt. Everest, Mike and Jay discuss Adam Sandler's latest film The Hateful Eight as well as Quentin Tarantino's latest film The Ridiculous 6.

2.title: The Revenant
2.plot: Mike and Jay talk about another movie set in the past, in the cold, and where people violently murder each other - Norm of the North.

3.title: Deadpool and Comic Book Movie Predictions
3.plot: Mike and Jay talk about Deadpool. Mr. Plinkett tries to hang himself. Then Mike and Jay discuss all the upcoming comic book movies, which makes them want to hang themselves too.

4.title: The 2016 Oscars
4.plot: With the Oscars right around the corner, Mike and Jay decide to shit on all the nominees.

5.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane and Me Him Her
5.plot: Mike and Jay watch the out of nowhere movie 10 Cloverfield Lane and then watch the out of nowhere movie Me Him Her. Pronouns VS Adresses - Movies are great again.

6.title: Batman v Superman
6.plot: Mike and Jay meet """Rich""" a new employee to Lightning Fast VCR Repair. They decide to see Batman V Superman and talk about it.

7.title: Hardcore Henry
7.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Hardcore Henry, the revolutionary, one-of-a-kind first person POV action movie that you've already forgotten about.

8.title: Green Room
8.plot: Mike and Jay decide to take a break from watching miserable movies that make you feel awful like Batman v Superman and instead see the most colorful, uplifting movie of the summer: Green Room.

9.title: Captain America: Civil War
9.plot: Mike, Jay and Rich see the latest feature film to showcase characters wearing colorful costumes while punching bad guys and then discuss it. This time, the latest feature film to showcase characters wearing colorful costumes while punching bad guys is titled Captain America: Civil War.

10.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
10.plot: After cleaning up blood, Mike and Jay saw the new X-Men film.

11.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
11.plot: Mike and Jay see the latest movie from Mike's favorite filmmaker Roland Emmerich. The results may shock you.

12.title: Ghostbusters
12.plot: Mike, Jay and some guy named Rich Evans talk about the new Ghostbusters movie that everyone else has already talked endlessly about.

13.title: Star Trek Beyond
13.plot: Mike and Jay see the new Star Trek film, Star Trek Beyond. Then Mike talks at Jay about all things Star Trek.

14.title: Suicide Squad
14.plot: Mike and Jay weigh in on the critical darling Suicide Squad.

15.title: Stranger Things
15.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the Netflix series Stranger Things, the first and last TV series to ever be discussed on Half in the Bag.

16.title: Blair Witch and Don't Breathe
16.plot: Mike and Jay are back at Mr. Plinkett's house, discussing to recent horror films: the rebootquel Blair Witch and Don't Breathe, a movie that isn't a sequel, reboot, or the first entry in a cinematic universe.

17.title: Box Office Number Crunching
17.plot: Mike and Jay take a break from watching new release garbage movies to talk about the garbage movies that have already come out this year. Mike also makes cynical predictions about the 2017 box office.

18.title: Doctor Strange
18.plot: Jay and Mike talk about another new Marvel film. Marvel at their amazing conversation. There's even a cameo by Stan Lee.

19.title: Shut in and Arrival
19.plot: Mike and Jay talk about Shut In, a new release movie that everybody has already forgotten exists, and Arrival, an intelligent science fiction drama that was beaten at the box office by an animated children's movie based on those big haired troll dolls.

20.title: 2016 Movie Catch-up
20.plot: Mike and Jay discuss a bunch of movies they've seen in 2016 that have the word "The" in the title.

21.title: Rogue One
21.plot: Mike and Jay are paid a visit by the City Inspector. They also talk about Disney's Star Wars Rogue One A Star Wars Story.

1.title: La La Land and Bye Bye Man
1.plot: Mike and Jay watch two recent movies only because their titles are somewhat similar.

2.title: Get Out and Logan
2.plot: While prepping engagement photos for Jay and Mr. Plinkett, because that's a thing that's happening now, Mike and Jay decide to take a break to talk about two recent movies, Get Out and Logan.

3.title: Life and Power Rangers
3.plot: Mike and Jay talk about two wonderful new films while Jay prepares his vows for his gay wedding with a syphilitic elderly man who hasn't showered in 7 years and has disgusting genital warts on his decades old fecal encrusted taint.

4.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
4.plot: While Mr. Plinkett rehearses for an important "on air" audition, Mike and Jay discuss Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2, the latest Marvel film from Marvel.

5.title: Alien: Covenant
5.plot: Mike and Jay watch the new film from famed elderly filmmaker Ridley Scott.

6.title: Wonder Woman
6.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the latest DCEU film Wonder Woman, the most important movie about an Amazonian Princess with a magic lasso that's ever been made.

7.title: The Mummy
7.plot: Mike and Jay saw the Tom Cruise Mummy movie.

8.title: Baby Driver and Spider-man: Homecoming
8.plot: Mike and Jay talk about the latest Edgar Wright movie Spider-man: Homecoming and the latest Marvel film Baby Driver.

9.title: Annabelle Creation
9.plot: Mike and Jay re-watch a lot of missed summer movies and the most important one of all, Annabelle: Creation. They also discuss Rotten Tomatoes and uncover the truth behind a sleazy contest.

10.title: IT (1990) and IT
10.plot: Mike and Jay compare the box office hit adaptation of Stephen King's "IT" to the nostalgic 90's TV movie version.

11.title: Mother!
11.plot: Mike and Jay talk about the controversial new film that's not controversial at all: mother.

12.title: Blade Runner 2049
12.plot: Mike and Jay share their feelings on the new Blade Runner sequel.

13.title: Thor: Ragnarok
13.plot: Mike and Jay get quizzed by Mr. Plinkett. They also talk about the new Thor film.

14.title: Justice League
14.plot: Mike, Jay and some guy named Rich discuss the latest DC movie Justice League, starring Batman, Superman's weird CGI upper lip, Wonder Woman and some other guys or whatever.

15.title: The Disaster Artist
15.plot: Frauds discuss frauds making a movie about a fraud making a movie. It's The Disaster Artist.

16.title: Star Wars: The Last Jedi
16.plot: In this special episode Rich, Mike and Jay talk about The Last Jedi. A movie that's complex, but subtle. Beautiful and awkward, clunky and unfunny. Good, yet very bad.

1.title: 2017 Movie Catch-up: Part 1
1.plot: Mike and Jay talk about a bunch of movies they saw last year. This is only half of them.

2.title: 2017 Movie Catch-up: Part 2
2.plot: Mike and Jay continue talking about movies they saw in 2017, mostly horribly depressing and miserable ones.

3.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
3.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Maze Runner: The Death Cure, which is the latest film in the Maze Runner series and is about The Death Cure.

4.title: The Cloverfield Paradox and the Netflix Conundrum
4.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the latest film in the Cloverfield "franchise," The Cloverfield Project, as well as it's release strategy of being dumped direct to Netflix.

5.title: Black Panther
5.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the 18th Marvel Cinematic Universe film, Black Panther. It's the first black superhero movie. It's the first comic-book movie to actually feel like a comic book. It's the first critically acclaimed comic book movie. So many firsts.

6.title: Annihilation
6.plot: Mike and Jay talk about a movie that came out recently and already flopped. See you on Netflix, Annihilation.

7.title: Demon House
7.plot: Mike and Jay discuss Demon House, the paranormal documentary about a dumpy little house with 100 demons living in it, directed by Zak Bagans from the Ghost Adventures TV show or whatever.

8.title: Ready Player One
8.plot: Mike and Jay watch "Ready Player One".

9.title: Truth or Dare and A Quiet Place
9.plot: Mike and Jay check out two "scary" movies, Truth or Dare and A Quiet Place. Spoiler: the good one has Michael Bay's name attached to it.

11.title: Solo: A Star Wars Story
11.plot: Mike, Jay, and Mike's drug induced hallucination name Rick Evans talk about the most unanticipated anticipation of a movie called "Solo: A Solo Wars Star Wars Solo Story".

12.title: Hereditary
12.plot: Look out. It's Hereditary. The movie that's being lauded as the scariest since The Exorcist. Until the next movie that gets lauded for being the scariest movie since The Exorcist.

13.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom
13.plot: Look out. It's Jurassic World. Let's see how stupid things can get.

14.title: Comic Con 2018 Trailers
14.plot: Mike and Jay discuss the latest batch of commercials...erm, trailers to come out of San Diego Comic Con. And they forced Rich Evans to watch them too.

15.title: Slender Man
15.plot: Oh no. It's Slender Man. How scaaaaaaarrrrryyyy.

16.title: 2018 Catch-Up (part 1 of 2)
16.plot: Mike and Jay discuss some of the films they have seen in the first half of 2018.

17.title: 2018 Catch-Up (part 2 of 2)
17.plot: Mike and Jay discuss some of the films they have seen in the first half of 2018.

18.title: Mandy and The Predator
18.plot: Look out. It's the Predator. He's here to cut and slash his movie into incoherence. Mike and Jay also saw a good movie as well.

19.title: Halloween
19.plot: Mike and Jay get a visit from their new boss Tim, who's there to evaluate their job performance while they discuss the new entry in the Halloween franchise called...Halloween. It's just called Halloween. Boooooooo Happy Halloween.

20.title: The Haunting of Hill House and Overlord
20.plot: Look out for ghosts. Mike and Jay talk about a TV show. But they're not going to talk about every TV show. They're just talking about this TV show. They also talk about Overlord. They will not talk about future Overlord movies because there won't be any because it flopped.

21.title: Aquaman
21.plot: OMG IT'S THE LATEST DCEU MOVIE. LOOK OUT, IT'S AQUAMAN. HE'S SOOO COOL.

imdb.plot outline: Half in the Bag is a Movie Review Show hosted by two VCR repairmen named Mike Stoklasa and Jay Bauman and broadcasted from the home of one of their customers, Harry S. Plinkett. Stoklasa's and Bauman's plan is to extend their work on Plinkett's broken VCR as long as they can while charging him unreasonable amounts of money, effectively robbing the man. The Show can go on as long as the two self-proclaimed "frauds" can trick Plinkett into paying them for doing nothing. They have gone out of their way so far in protecting themselves from honest work by retrieving the lost VCR, going back in time and murdering people. Along the way they met lots of other people in Plinketts home, have traveled all across Milwaukee and even America, living through tons of wacky adventures. The main focus of the show though are the conversations Mike and Jay have about movies they saw, conventions they've been to and their experiences with all of it. Since they both have a background of making videos and movies (together), their analysis of movies exceeds into discussing the technical aspects of them as well as talking about the story. After retelling the personal impression movies made on them, explaining how those feelings are based in what the movie is and giving the viewers a general opinion on movies, that are like the one they just saw, they briefly state, if they'd recommend the movie or not. Convention coverage, on the other hand, is mostly a report of things they experienced going to Movie/Comic/Game/TV conventions. In these segments, they'll always have footage and interviews of where they were invited to and comment on the culture and the people, that go to those things. A lot of Mike and Jay's opinions tend to differ strongly from popular opinions, which makes them unique in the Internet Reviewer Culture.
imdb.title: Half in the Bag
plot: Two VCR repairmen, Mike and Jay, scam an elderly man out of his fortune by discussing movies while on the job, and occasionally go on eccentric misadventures.

_Half in the Bag_ (qv) is a Movie Review Show hosted by two VCR repairmen named Mike Stoklasa and Jay Bauman and broadcasted from the home of one of their customers, Harry S. Plinkett. Stoklasa's and Bauman's plan is to extend their work on Plinkett's broken VCR as long as they can while charging him unreasonable amounts of money, effectively robbing the man. The Show can go on as long as the two self-proclaimed "frauds" can trick Plinkett into paying them for doing nothing. They have gone out of their way so far in protecting themselves from honest work by retrieving the lost VCR, going back in time and murdering people. Along the way they met lots of other people in Plinketts home, have traveled all across Milwaukee and even America, living through tons of wacky adventures. The main focus of the show though are the conversations Mike and Jay have about movies they saw, conventions they've been to and their experiences with all of it. Since they both have a background of making videos and movies (together), their analysis of movies exceeds into discussing the technical aspects of them as well as talking about the story. After retelling the personal impression movies made on them, explaining how those feelings are based in what the movie is and giving the viewers a general opinion on movies, that are like the one they just saw, they briefly state, if they'd recommend the movie or not. Convention coverage, on the other hand, is mostly a report of things they experienced going to Movie/Comic/Game/TV conventions. In these segments, they'll always have footage and interviews of where they were invited to and comment on the culture and the people, that go to those things. A lot of Mike and Jay's opinions tend to differ strongly from popular opinions, which makes them unique in the Internet Reviewer Culture.::Benno Drews
